event.title: 2010 census, the city had a population of 76,377, which had risen

data.event: As of the 2010 census, the city had a population of 76,377, which had risen to an estimated 78,197 as of 2014.

event.title: years; his essays and poems were first published

data.event: Lawrence was the residence of poet Robert Frost for his early school years; his essays and poems were first published in the Lawrence High School newspaper.
Evidence of farming at Den Rock Park and arrowhead manufacturing on the site of where the Wood Mill now sits have been discovered.
Europeans first settled the Haverhill area in 1640, colonists from Newbury following the Merrimack River in from the coast.
The first settlement came in 1655 with the establishment of a blockhouse in Shawsheen Fields, now South Lawrence.

event.title: the establishment of a blockhouse in Shawsheen Fields, now

data.event: The first settlement came in 1655 with the establishment of a blockhouse in Shawsheen Fields, now South Lawrence.
